step1.sentence: Please don't leave out any important details when you write the report.

step2.story: Sarah reviewed the guest list for her wedding and realized she had accidentally left out her cousin's family. She felt terrible and immediately called them to apologize. They laughed it off, saying they knew it was just an honest mistake.

step3.story: When the new team manager posted the project schedule, three developers noticed their names had been left out entirely. They assumed it was an oversight and politely brought it up at the morning standup. The manager turned red and apologized, explaining that he had copied an old version of the spreadsheet. He promised to update it by lunch. By the afternoon, everyone was included, but the incident reminded the team how easy it is to leave someone out without even realizing it. From then on, they always double-checked the roster before publishing anything.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '밖에 남겨두다'라는 뜻으로, 어떤 것을 포함시키지 않고 빼놓는다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 목록이나 계획에서 실수로 또는 의도적으로 누군가/무언가를 빠뜨리거나 제외할 때 사용합니다. 사람에게 쓰면 '소외시키다'라는 감정적 뉘앙스도 있습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: leave(남기다)와 out(밖에)의 결합으로, '밖에 남겨두다' → '포함시키지 않다'로 의미가 발전했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 실수로 빠뜨린 경우와 의도적으로 제외한 경우 모두에 쓰입니다. 사람에게 쓸 때는 '따돌리다'에 가까운 부정적 느낌이 될 수 있어 주의가 필요합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You left out the most important part of the story.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 네가 이야기에서 가장 중요한 부분을 빠뜨렸어.
